content.text: Explain containerization vs virtualization. Be concise.

Containerization and virtualization are both methods of running isolated environments, but they differ in fundamental ways:

Virtualization:
- Creates complete virtual machines (VMs)
- Each VM has its own operating system
- Uses more resources (memory, storage)
- Slower to start up
- Better isolation
- Example: VMware, VirtualBox

Containerization:
- Shares host OS kernel
- Lightweight, only packages necessary components
- Uses fewer resources
- Starts up quickly
- Less isolated but more efficient
- Example: Docker, Kubernetes

Key difference: VMs virtualize the entire hardware stack, while containers virtualize only the OS level.
